title: V-E Day 60th Anniversary (Last Days of WWII)
description: Join THE HISTORY CHANNEL in a look back at the individuals and events surrounding this watershed day. It captures both the celebrations and the heartbreak of the end of the European war; chronicling our reentry into a post-Hitler world that could never be the same again. * Last Days of WWII: May 6 - May 12, 1945 - After nearly six years of conflict and the death of millions, Germany surrenders unconditionally. The war in Europe is over at last. * Hitler's Last Days - Joseph Goebbel's diaries help us gain a fresh understanding of life inside Hitler's bunker during the final days of the Third Reich. * Doenitz: The Successor - Take a look at the man Hitler appointed as his successor - the man responsible for "winding up" the war. * Edward R. Murrow: The Voice of America - A moving portrait of the man many felt was the voice of World War II. * The Fall of Berlin - Examine the events culminating in the final surrender of Hitler's Berlin.
store: The History Channel  (Director),     Edward R. Murrow  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
